Applying Maintenance Mode to Resources
Log in to &hawk2;: https://HAWKSERVER:7630/
In the left navigation bar, select Status.
On the Resources tab, select the resource you want to put in maintenance mode.
In the Operations column, click the arrow down icon next to the resource and select Maintenance. Confirm your choice.
The Status screen is updated. The Status column now shows the Maintenance Mode icon for the resource. The Operations column next to the resources changes, too.
Finish the maintenance task for the resource.
To deactivate maintenance mode for the resource, got to the Operations column and click Disable Maintenance Mode.
From this point on, the resource will be managed by the &hasi; software again.
Applying Maintenance Mode to Nodes
Sometimes it is necessary to put single nodes into maintenance mode.
Log in to &hawk2;: https://HAWKSERVER:7630/
In the left navigation bar, select Status and switch to the Nodes tab.
On the Nodes tab, the Maintenance column shows the status of the node: A red icon means that the node is in maintenance mode. A green icon means that the node is in normal mode and can be switched to maintenance mode.
To switch a node to maintenance mode, click the respective icon next to the resource and confirm your choice.
This will add the following instance attribute to the node: maintenance="true". The resources previously running on this node will become unmanaged. No new resources will be allocated to the node until it leaves the maintenance mode.
Finish the maintenance task for the node.
To deactivate the maintenance mode, click the maintenance icon next to the node and confirm your choice.
Applying Maintenance Mode to the Cluster
For setting or unsetting the maintenance mode for the whole cluster, proceed as follows:
Log in to &hawk2;: https://HAWKSERVER:7630/
In the left navigation bar, select Cluster Configuration.
In the Cluster Configuration part of the screen, select the maintenance-mode attribute from the empty drop-down box and click the plus icon to add it.
To put the cluster into maintenance mode, set the value of maintenance-mode to Yes and apply your changes.
Finish the maintenance task for the whole cluster.
To deactivate maintenance mode for the cluster, set the value of maintenance-mode to no and apply this change.
From this point on, the &hasi; will take over cluster management again.
